ca.cgjennings.ui.textedit

Class ErrorHighlighter

  • java.lang.Object
    • ca.cgjennings.ui.textedit.ErrorHighlighter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Highlighter
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    SpellingHighlighter, SyntaxChecker.Highlighter

    public abstract class ErrorHighlighter
extends Object
implements Highlighter
    An abstract base class for highlighters that draw squiggly error underlines beneath the highlighted text.
    Since:
    3.0

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructor and Description
      ErrorHighlighter()

        public ErrorHighlighter()

    • Method Detail

      • getColor

        public final Color getColor()
        Returns the colour used to draw the error squiggle.
        Returns:
        the error colour

      • isLineAllowedToOverlapCaret

        public boolean isLineAllowedToOverlapCaret()
        Returns true if the error line is allowed to overlap the caret. When set to false, a call to paintErrorLine(java.awt.Graphics2D, ca.cgjennings.ui.textedit.HighlightedLine, int, int) will not actually draw an error line when the caret falls within the start and end bounds of the line.
        Returns:
        true if lines should always be drawn

      • paintErrorLine

        protected void paintErrorLine(Graphics2D g,
                              HighlightedLine hl,
                              int start,
                              int end)
        Paints an error line under the characters from the start offset to the end offset in the line. The concrete subclass should call this as needed from Highlighter.paint(java.awt.Graphics2D, ca.cgjennings.ui.textedit.HighlightedLine) whenever it determines that a new error line should be drawn. After all processing is complete, and before the paint method returns, it is important to call
        Parameters:
        g - the graphics context to use for painting
        hl - the line information passed from the editor
        start - the offset into the line at which the line begins
        end - the offset into the line at which the line ends

      • restore

        protected void restore(Graphics2D g)
        This method must be called before Highlighter.paint(java.awt.Graphics2D, ca.cgjennings.ui.textedit.HighlightedLine) returns to restore the graphics context to its original state. If this is not called, unexpected painting effects may be observed.
        Parameters:
        g - the painting context

      • setColor

        public final void setColor(Color color)
        Sets the colour used to draw the error squiggle. The default is Color.RED.
        Parameters:
        color - the colour to draw subsequent error lines

      • setLineAllowedToOverlapCaret

        public void setLineAllowedToOverlapCaret(boolean lineAllowedToOverlapCaret)
        Sets whether error lines are allowed to overlap the caret. If set to false (the default), error lines are not drawn when the caret falls within their bounds.
        Parameters:
        lineAllowedToOverlapCaret - true if lines will always be drawn
